item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Sir William Bragg
item.description: "I feel very strongly indeed that a Cambridge education for our scientists should include some contact with the humanistic side. The gift of expression is important to them as scientists; the best research is wasted when it is extremely difficult to discover what it is all about ... It is even more important when scientists are called upon to play their part in the world of affairs, as is happening to an increasing extent." -- Sir William Bragg

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Thomas H. Huxley
item.description: "The science, the art, the jurisprudence, the chief political and social theories, of the modern world have grown out of Greece and Rome—not by favour of, but in the teeth of, the fundamental teachings of early Christianity, to which science, art, and any serious occupation with the things of this world were alike despicable." -- Thomas H. Huxley

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Robert Cringely
item.description: "If the automobile had followed the same development as the computer, a Rolls Royce would today cost $100, get a million miles per gallon, and explode once a year killing everyone inside. " -- Robert Cringely

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before." -- Mae West

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Tallulah Bankhead
item.description: "Nobody can be exactly like me. Sometimes even I have trouble doing it." -- Tallulah Bankhead

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Mel Brooks
item.description: "Tragedy is when I cut my finger. Comedy is when you fall into an open sewer and die." -- Mel Brooks

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I don't want to achieve immortality through my work; I want to achieve immortality through not dying. I don't want to live on in the hearts of my countrymen; I want to live on in my apartment." -- Woody Allen

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "From now on, ending a sentence with a preposition is something up with which I will not put." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "HOMICIDE, n. The slaying of one human being by another. There are four kinds of homicide: felonious, excusable, justifiable, and praiseworthy, but it makes no great difference to the person slain whether he fell by one kind or another -- the classification is for advantage of the lawyers." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I don't know the question, but sex is definitely the answer." -- Woody Allen

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I'm not afraid of death; I just don't want to be there when it happens." -- Woody Allen

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "To you, I'm an atheist. To God, I'm the loyal opposition." -- Woody Allen

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "More than any other time in history, mankind faces a crossroads. One path leads to despair and utter hopelessness. The other, to total extinction. Let us pray we have the wisdom to choose correctly." -- Woody Allen

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "To love is to suffer. To avoid suffering one must not love. But then one suffers from not loving. Therefore, to love is to suffer; not to love is to suffer; to suffer is to suffer. To be happy is to love. To be happy, then, is to suffer, but suffering makes one unhappy. Therefore, to be happy one must love or love to suffer or suffer from too much happiness." -- Woody Allen

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "That young girl is one of the least benightedly unintelligent organic life forms it has been my profound lack of pleasure not to be able to avoid meeting." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Judith Martin
item.description: "There are three possible parts to a date, of which at least two must be offered: entertainment, food, and affection. It is customary to begin a series of dates with a great deal of entertainment, a moderate amount of food, and the merest suggestion of affection. As the amount of affection increases, the entertainment can be reduced proportionately. When the affection IS the entertainment, we no longer call it dating. Under no circumstances can the food be omitted." -- Judith Martin

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Heinrich Heine
item.description: "Ordinarily he was insane, but he had lucid moments when he was merely stupid" -- Heinrich Heine

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "There is a theory which states that if ever anyone discovers exactly what the Universe is for and why it is here, it will instantly disappear and be replaced by something even more bizarre and inexplicable. There is another theory which states that this has already happened." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The Guide says there is an art to flying", said Ford, "or rather a knack. The knack lies in learning how to throw yourself at the ground and miss." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Don't Panic." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The ships hung in the sky in much the same way that bricks don't." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Do not meddle in the affairs of wizards, for they are subtle and quick to anger." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "And so it goes..." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Really, he thought, if you couldn't trust a poet to offer sensible advice, who could you trust?" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: This Is Not The Michael You're Looking For add a quote by China Miéville
item.description: "The aim of a PhD's to ensure that no one, including your advisor, understands what you're doing after the first couple of years." -- China Miéville
